title: Google Maps Platform: 3 new APIs to monitor environmental conditions - The Keyword | Google Product and Technology News
summary: Google is expanding its sustainability tools with new products in the Google Maps Platform, such as tools to map solar potential, air quality, and pollen levels. These products utilize AI, machine learning, aerial imagery, and environmental data to help users mitigate environmental impact and support sustainability efforts.

business_innovation: TRUE Google is introducing new products that enhance its Google Maps Platform, utilizing innovative technologies to provide insights into solar potential, air quality, and pollen levels. These new products represent a business innovation for Google as they differ significantly from its previous offerings and bring new value to the market.
green_product: TRUE Google's new products, focused on mapping solar potential, air quality, and environmental data, are designed and developed to significantly reduce environmental impact throughout their lifecycle. They utilize AI, machine learning, and aerial imagery to promote sustainability and mitigate environmental impact, aligning with the definition of green products.
green_process: FALSE While the article discusses the use of AI, machine learning, and advanced technologies, it does not specifically mention the implementation of methods or techniques in manufacturing or production that minimize environmental impacts. Therefore, it does not directly address green processes.

title: Shanghai Electric Delivers the First Batch of VRFB Products to Europe - PR Newswire

title: Morrow Batteries aim to realise the first prismatic LNMO battery cell in the world early 2024 | Morrow Batteries - Mynewsdesk
